captions.text: (upbeat music)
- I am so hot right now.
I'm like really overheated,
I'm not sure if I'm talking fast,
I can't tell.
- I'm fidgeting.
I'm wringing my hands,
which I don't think I was doing before.
I'm also talking faster.
I can tell that I'm talking faster.
I can tell that I'm thinking faster.

- I can't stop moving
and typing really fast.

- It's like the end of the
night when you're drinking,
you're like, "I'm still hyper
"cause I still got alcohol in me
"but I'm probably gonna fall asleep
"in the middle of the street."
- So I'm still amped up,
but not in a good way.

I think that I'm feeling
a little more energetic
than earlier but I don't know.
- I actually feel better than yesterday.
Monster hit me super fast
and then I was kind of like crazy.
I'm just kinda going.
Not too hyper, but not tired.
- Whatever sort of uptick that I was on
I'm on the other side now.
- It's been like a slower build.
It's been like this.
You know, rather than...

- I'm having a hard
time sitting at my seat.

Like staying at my seat
and getting my work done.
I think this might be a good drink
if I was gonna like go out and...
I don't know.
Skateboard or something.
- I'm feeling kinda tired right now
'cause the adrenaline is going down,
but when I am focusing on something,
I'm really focused.
I can get it all done.
I can multi-task which is nice.

But I'm wondering by now
if it's psychological.
Definitely feel both more scatterbrained
and forgetful than I normally am.
- I don't know.
I feel lethargic.

title: How Well Do Energy Drinks Really Work?

still common, and I don't crash. I drink them because I didn't get enough

like I never had it in the first place but I still had an extra hour of 
sleep.﻿

comments.author: Cameron24529

comments.text:
+Cameron24529 Pharmacy student here. They contain caffeine (usually at a 
concentration of 0.03g/100 mL which is relatively high) to inhibit the 
adenosine a2 receptor in the brain, responsible for feelings of tiredness. 
So when the receptor causing the tiredness is blocked, this leads to 
increased attentiveness and concentration. Depending on the amount of 
caffeine in the energy drink and the quality of the caffeine, they work. 
Unless you have consumed so much caffeine in your life that you are immune 
to their effects.
